title: Add cub docs command to open documentation in browser

task.title: Add cub docs command to open documentation in browser
task.description: Other tools (Vercel, Supabase) have a CLI command to open docs in the default browser. Discovered during docs overhaul research. See also GH #73.

commits.message: feature(cub-001): Add cub docs command to open documentation in browser

outcome.approach: Discovered that the `cub docs` command already existed and was fully functional. Rather than re-implementing, added comprehensive test coverage to ensure the feature was properly documented and maintained. This approach verified the existing implementation while establishing confidence in its correctness.
decisions: Created test file (`tests/test_cli_docs.py`) rather than adding tests to an existing test module, following the established pattern of dedicated test files per CLI command
Tested both online docs (default behavior) and local docs (`--local` flag) to ensure complete feature coverage
Included tests for error handling (browser open failures) to verify graceful degradation
lessons_learned: Always check for existing implementations before implementing new features—the feature may already be present but undocumented or untested
Following established test patterns in the codebase (test file naming, test structure) reduces review friction and ensures consistency
Comprehensive test coverage of existing features can validate their correctness and serve as documentation for future maintainers, even when the feature itself wasn't newly added
